      • rotate90

        @Deprecated
public static int rotate90(int type,
                                        int data)
        Deprecated. use BlockData.rotate90(int, int)
        Rotate a block's data value 90 degrees (north->east->south->west->north);
        Parameters:
        type - type ID of the block
        data - data value of the block
        Returns:
        a new data value

      • cycle

        @Deprecated
public static int cycle(int type,
                                     int data,
                                     int increment)
        Deprecated. use BlockData.cycle(int, int, int)
        Cycle a block's data value. This usually goes through some rotational pattern depending on the block. If it returns -1, it means the id and data specified do not have anything to cycle to.
        Parameters:
        type - block id to be cycled
        data - block data value that it starts at
        increment - whether to go forward (1) or backward (-1) in the cycle
        Returns:
        the new data value for the block

      • nextClothColor

        @Deprecated
public static int nextClothColor(int data)
        Deprecated. use BlockData.nextClothColor(int)
        Returns the data value for the next color of cloth in the rainbow. This should not be used if you want to just increment the data value.
        Parameters:
        data - the data value
        Returns:
        a new data value

      • prevClothColor

        @Deprecated
public static int prevClothColor(int data)
        Deprecated. use BlockData.prevClothColor(int)
        Returns the data value for the previous ext color of cloth in the rainbow. This should not be used if you want to just increment the data value.
        Parameters:
        data - the data value
        Returns:
        a new data value
